title: Can we get Auto Attack animation improvements across the board?
body:
On champions whose AA animations make it ridiculously difficult to CS with, I mean.

Is there really any reason why, for example, Anivia has to have 2/3x as much difficulty last hitting until level 6 as...say...Syndra?

It doesn't feel like a genuine challenge, it doesn't feel like you're being skillful to time it differently, it just feels like you're being handicapped by outdated animations...


**EDIT:**
Wow.  Uh.

It seems that someone checked my LolKing and noticed I'm a big fan of Karthus {{champion:30}} , and now everyone thinks this is about him?

I think Karthus AA animation is way too easy to cancel, but I'm fine with it because your Q is supposed to be used for last-hitting, and your E functions as an instantaneous auto attack if used skillfully.  He has enough CS'ing tools as it is.  This isn't a complaint about Karthus at all.

This is more about champions whose slow AA speed feels completely arbitrary, like they just didn't think about how bad it was when they programmed it, or they just don't care because the champion is old.  (While newer champions get excellent AA animations regardless of their kit strength.  Like Azir.  His AA animation is fantastic.  Very quick and reliable.  They didn't make it horrible to force you into cs'ing with your soldiers.)

replies.body: Quinn's arrows can be literally half way to their target and you can still cancel the animation :l
{{champion:16}} Banana.
As someone who wanted to be a Quinn main early on, that was always one of the most painful things.  Didn't help that I was fairly new to the game.

{{champion:6}} 

Except his AA range is SO short
Teemo. Every time I wait until I hear the dart whoosh, then I click away, then no attack happens. Rito pls.

I do this with Viktor all the time, especially with his q-empowered auto.
I think you can cancel that (via minion dying or just plain moving) for a split second AFTER the laser fires (while still retaining the charge).

Vel'Koz, on the other hand, has one of the best ranged autos in the game; it's basically a ranged melee, and is super quick.  I love last hitting with Vel when I'm not waveclearing with his w.

I feel your Viktor pain.

Sometimes Vel's aa is too good.  I've had times when I'll miss cs because I got used to the delay on other champs.  I basically aa early because I don't expect it to be so responsive.
Vel'Koz is super fun to play anyways.

>
> Teemo. Every time I wait until I hear the dart whoosh, then I click away, then no attack happens. Rito pls.

It's funny because it depends on the champion on what you have to rely on. Such as Teemo is via animation not sound while Quinn is via sound not animation. Honestly they should just hire some people to start working on basic things for champions.
Anivia is intentionally made with a bad animation since she's supposed to have a hard time until 6.

> [{quoted}](name=LupusNox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ko5NnAEd,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2014-12-28T18:36:03.694+0000)
>
> I really don't feel that the animations should be a part of a champs power budget
> 
> new champs are released with huge potential in their kits for damage, yet they auto creeps just fine before they have the ability to use 1 or 2 abilities and waveclear
> 
> {{champion:115}}  and {{champion:101}} have huge waveclear potential, and IMO, have way better auto animations that {{champion:34}}

This. At no point should animations be an inhibitor PERIOD, lest it be a serious part of the design. 

Anivia is an a weird spot too. Her QoL buffs weren't even that QoL given how other mids are performing right now. I don't see any issue with her seeing an animation rehaul, especially for her AA.
Maybe they're waiting until they can overhaul her rig and model to get to that?

> [{quoted}](name=junglerboy16,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ko5NnAEd,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2014-12-28T22:47:46.184+0000)
>
> Maybe they're waiting until they can overhaul her rig and model to get to that?

It's plausible, but it's also plausible they aren't. Anivia isn't exactly in a rush for an overhaul according to Riot, just like Cho'Gath. My statement was more of a reinforcement for an old bird that needs QoL rather than a cynical accusation.

Actually, her auto used to be extremely good at harassing. Towers and minions only react on damage, and her projectile moved so slow that she could harass under tower without pulling aggro. The projectile speed increase was a buff to unskilled Anivia players, and a nerf to Anivia mains.

I guess we could just simplify the game more and normalize all attack animations. Game's becomes homogenized really badly as it is.

> [{quoted}](name=killd0zer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ko5NnAEd,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2014-12-28T22:08:46.697+0000)
>
> Actually, her auto used to be extremely good at harassing. Towers and minions only react on damage, and her projectile moved so slow that she could harass under tower without pulling aggro. The projectile speed increase was a buff to unskilled Anivia players, and a nerf to Anivia mains.

Yeah. I'd like to see Riot make Anivia's projectile speed slower, while making her AA animation faster.

Damage point is a very important and understated part of a champion's power budget.

Here are the things it affects:
Ability to kite with autoattacks
Ability to last hit
Time standing still to last hit
Time standing still to harass
Ability to recover from last hitting mistakes
Burst combo speed (assuming autoattacks are included in it)

every single time you autoattack

the relevance of each is a little different from champion to champion, but it is not to be underestimated

replies.body:
THIS is why it's so frustrating to play against Caitlyn. It's not her range thats op, it's her attack animation. It has ZERO windup. If you walk into her range, you get autoattacked twice - once for entering her range, and again because she started her attack one iota-nano-millisecond before you left her aa range.

Compared to someone like ezreal or corki - you walk into their range, and the entire auto attack has to play and be in the air before it's a guaranteed hit.
Which is ironic because she's a sniper, but it takes her literally no time at all to aim her shots.
From years of playing COD caitlyn has learned how to quick scope.
She needs to play some TF2 with the default rifle.
Corki's is pretty quick too.

If they ever cleaned up Blitzcranks auto attack animation to make autoattack/e/hydra activation less clunky I'd start running that glorious golden bastard top again. 

God I miss it.
Any ranged champ that can cancel their animation when the projectile is mid-flight and get no damage on it needs to be looked at. Which is... an absurdly large number of champs.

Wouldn't have upvoted if not for the edit. Not that I don't agree with you, I'm just neutral about it. But the original point of the thread, like most things in life, seemed to go over every lowlife troll's head to the point that they actually investigated your profile, which is, in itself, a dick move.

{{champion:30}} 

Oh wait
{{champion:9}}

Auto attacks were NEVER a balance point, and Riot flat out said that clarity is one of the most important ways to ensure champion health.  Also Karthus isn't bad because of that, it's because he's unbalanceable.  He'll either be weak, or insta-kill everyone on the map every 3 minutes, and mid lane every 30 seconds.

I don't know what champion update you were looking at, but Karthus' AA were improved.  It used to take him fucking forever to AA something, on top of his AS being shit.  Now if I had to guess, it takes half as long.

> [{quoted}](name=Remlap1223,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ko5NnAEd,comment-id=0005000000000000,timestamp=2014-12-28T22:21:29.266+0000)
>
> I don't know what champion update you were looking at, but Karthus' AA were improved.  It used to take him fucking forever to AA something, on top of his AS being shit.  Now if I had to guess, it takes half as long.

Yeah I remember the old:
1. I'm moving my stick back
2. I'm moving it even further back
3. Swiiiiinnnng
4. Projectile taking its sweet time enjoying the view until it hits your minion

I agree that it's still pretty hard to last hit with. I think the reason is that you're supposed to be using your Q as your auto attack and makes it difficult to get free mana from his W/E passive (whichever has the DOT circle).

Swain. AA so annoying mmffm


Lee sin and Teemo need fixed as well, Right clicking on something to quickly can actually cause you to not attack it at all for some reason on these 2.
When I first played Swain I couldn't last hit at all.  It's so weird, but the projectile speed is so fast.  Also why does he shoot little tiny molten balls of rock covered in fire?
I am hoping that when they redo swains visuals, as they said they are in the early state of, his AA is improved, it is hard enough to clear waves as it is pre-six.
I thought they just improved Anivia's AA a while back

I have this problem with jinx rockets sometimes.  On more than one occasions I have launched a rocket at someone under a turret for the finishing blow, and it cancels right before it hits them.  They walk away alive with brown pants.
Agreed. My favorite part of Viktor's rework was the new AA

I find {{champion:4}}'s AA has a very, very slight delay and I find it harder to last hit with him sometimes.

This hurts his early game more than anything but it's still annoying.

Malzahar and Vlad both have really bad animations, but to be honest I consider each to be appropriately bad. Malz has his E which can clear an entire wave, as well as his passive to help early on.

Vlad, on the other hand, is supposed to have a hard laning phase in exchange for his truly disgusting late game.

I think a lot of these are intentional, and frankly, champions like Syndra, with a powerful lategame and even laning phase, should probably have bad animations to compensate.

I would have to agree, vlad and malz easily have the worst AA's in the game but have other tools of csing, such as E on both champs and both of their q's end up making up for it early game. Although I would agree with the overall feel that aa animations should not be made to hinder or impede the champions overall power.
I find Janna's AA needlessly slow and unresponsive compared to every other support. Way too easy to cancel. Even if it is one of the better looking AA's.

I don't mind clumsy AA so long as when I release the auto it hits and doesn't cancel/pop mid air or hit when its clearly finished releasing or making contact which is a very real problem for a lot of champs.

If they could also make Anivia's in game model and splash art NOT as ugly as sin, that would be great too.

The most challenging part about playing her is looking at her...
I agree.

It's defiantly true. A lot of them need fixes, but mostly about the when the projectile counts as a projectile. 

Most champions with slow AA's have it for a reason. Your Anivia for example has an AA range of 600. More than most rADC's. Top it off with the level of security she has pack in her kit. Do you really want her viable as an ADC? Because that'll be what happens if the make her AA animation too good. Most of the slow AA's are simply to add a level of challenge to their laning. Or that making them good would make them too good in lane(for example Swain could QEaa for a lot of targeted damage). 

But there for sure needs to be some fixes on the projectiles.

You have a +1 from me.

It's not a life-or-death improvement. But it'd be really fun to have. Considering every champion that wasn't a jungler/support  all had pretty optimized AA.
